title: Add downloadable sample upload file templates for the import feature

requirements.text: Add downloadable sample/template files for the Import Lists feature so users can easily download a file, fill it in, and upload it back into the app.

quotes: Can u add a sample file to upload easy for everyone

acceptanceCriteria: The app includes at least one downloadable sample CSV file placed in the frontend static/public assets and accessible via a visible control in the Import Lists card.

The app includes a downloadable sample Excel template (.xlsx) that matches the current XLSX import expectations (sheets named "Parties" and/or "Items"; first row treated as header; values listed starting from the second row).

The sample CSV template matches the current CSV import expectations by including a header row with columns that the parser recognizes (e.g., "partyName" and "itemName") and at least a few example rows.
Clicking the download control(s) downloads the template file(s) without requiring any backend calls.
All user-facing text added for this feature is in English.

requirements.text: Update the Import Lists UI copy to clearly explain (in short form) that users can download a sample template and that the template matches the supported CSV/XLSX formats already described in the Import Lists card.

quotes: Can u add a sample file to upload easy for everyone

acceptanceCriteria: The Import Lists card includes a brief line of text and/or helper text that references the availability of the sample template download(s).
The existing import instructions remain accurate (CSV columns like "partyName"/"itemName"; Excel sheets "Parties" and "Items").

constraints: Do not add any backend upload or backend parsing; templates must be served as static frontend assets.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep the existing CSV/XLSX parsing behavior in frontend/src/lib/importLists/parseImportedLists.ts compatible with the provided templates.
nonGoals: Adding new spreadsheet formats beyond the currently supported CSV/XLSX.
Changing how imported lists are persisted (localStorage behavior stays as-is).
Adding authentication or any backend state for imported lists.
